## dialectic  

There is an astonishing consistency in the dialectic of signs, almost as if the _writing_ gave rise to multiple _spoken_ languages:  

[ğ’€€](ğ’€€.html) AQUA â‡” ğ“ ğ“® QUA-â€¦ [ğˆ](ğˆ.html)â€¦ / Ñ¥i? / ğ“‹´? / ge? / que? / qui? / qwer? (gehts gut?) / quand? ÎºÎ±Ï„Î¬ ğ“ğ“ğ“†‘?   ğ“‡‹ğ“†µğ“‡³  
[ğ’€€](ğ’€€.html) Wasser â‡” [ğˆ](ğˆ.html) Wâ€¦ ÙˆÙ‚Øª ğ“Šªğ“…® what ğ“Šªğ“…± who ğ“‡‹ğ“…± wer wie wo wann warum was wasser? ğ“Šªğ“ğ“‚‹ !?! â‡” [Wahrheit](Wahrheit.html) ğ“‡‹ğ“±ğ“ˆ™ğ“‹´ğ“? [ist](ist.html)>echt?  
[ğ’€€](ğ’€€.html) Marin â‡” é©¬ [MA](MA.html) [ğ“…“](ğ“…“.html)[ğ“‚](ğ“‚.html) Ù…ÙÙ† â€¦ (modality pronoun prefix / suffix ) â‡” [Maat](Maat.html)
